title: Recruitment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cleveland, OH)
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews! One with manager, peer, then the director. Behavioral based questions and then just asking about past work history to make sure it’s a good fit. Enjoyed meeting peers before accepting job as well!
Interview Questions: How would you handle a tough manager

title: Patient Service Representative II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Great management.. offer pay is good. Interview process and easy. Turn around time was good between waiting after sending application. I had a good experience with the whole process. Don’t have any doubts. Apply and you won’t be disappointed
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was nice . The staff was nice. Questions were easy. Simple process in my opinion . Interview was nice . The staff was nice. Questions were easy. Simple process in my opinion
Interview Questions: When was a time something didn’t go as planned.

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I was brought in without an interview, which should have been my first indication that this role wouldn’t be a correct fit in the end. I stayed for about 1.5 years, but then it got to be too much.
Interview Questions: When Is a good day for you to start?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy, quick and managers were helpful and made the experience comfortable and personal. Answered all of my questions and explained everything thoroughly. Excited to start working there as a nurse
Interview Questions: What would the coworkers say about you if they knew you

title: RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview questions. Phone screen by HR preceded by scheduled interviews with manager/director in the desired department. Called back for a peer interview after. Extended verbal offer but never heard back after two weeks upon writer's time of review.
Interview Questions: Standard situational based interview questions

title: Emergency Room Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview with the unit supervisor. Interview happens in the ER conference room followed by tour. Most of the questions were related to dealing with conflict in the work place.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an experience of when you didn’t agree with a supervisor.

title: Adult Protective and Community Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: They made me feel so good thought the process. I felt heard. It was great getting to have a conversation with them. I would have loved to have them for my boss.
Interview Questions: What I would do in certain stressful situations.

title: Patient Care Associate (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Lorain, OH) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview went smooth.   I was nervous but was eased by openess and friendliness of interviewer.  Was offered the option to do a walk through of unit before accepting position which is great in healthcare.  To actual see the work environment to determine if it's a good fit is a great opportunity.
Interview Questions:
What were my goals?
What's something that I did that I went above what was asked of me?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: It was at their Career Fair. It was Face to face, but in a comfortable setting thorough, I was treated like a professional. I did have about a 15 minute wait.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: ICU Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process is fast and accurate. The interviewer is knowledgeable. Some questions are difficult but are expected for ICu nurse. I will have 2nd interview in person next week so we shall see.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Mercy Health?

title: Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. They got back to me very fast after applying and asked me a couple questions before suggesting a face to face interview. Very helpful with explaining the job and the duties that would be assigned if employed. Overall it was a good experience
Interview Questions: How many years of experience, what setting I would like etc

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Employer quick to reach out and get you in for an interview.Very Thorough with  the process. Offer several options! Online, Phone along with in person interviews. One of the most simple interview processes.
Interview Questions:
What am I looking for
Skills
Availability

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, it was difficult to find the right job but once I've got a hold of a recruiter it was very seamless and easy . Started within 3 weeks after the initial interview
Interview Questions: How would you describe your style of management

title: PGY1 Pharmacy Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview process consisted of multiple interviews of both behavioral and technical knowledge based questions.  Interviewers were all very friendly.  There was a presentation required on a pharmacy related topic.  There were not many questions when I presented but it did not end up being a big deal.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then two tiers of in-person interviews, one of which was performed by a community leader in the area the practice would serve.  Communication between interviews was clear.  Largely similar questions asked during each interview.
Interview Questions: How would you use your clinic management skills in this role?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Clermont County, OH) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screening first, then an in-person interview. Wore dress professional. Was not very pressured but still professional. had one interviewer--I do not believe this is necessarily standard though
Interview Questions:
"Tell me about yourself" 
"Tell me about your schooling...previous experience..." 
What personality type are you

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Currently Zoom for first interview, not sure what next steps are as of right now but I am hopeful it will be in person. I still have to partake in the interview so fingers are crossed as I have heard great and positive things about the company.
Interview Questions: They asked about experiences and education history.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Talked to a recruiter within two weeks of putting in and application. Got an interview about a week later. Interview was pretty basic, mostly interested in hearing about previous job experience (not just nursing). Heard back I’m about a week.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about yourself.

title: Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: They ask simple situational questions and they ask standard behavioral questions. I wouldn't say there is anything out of the ordinary. The interview is probably about thirty minutes long. Should hear back in a few days.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to multi-task.

title: Telemetry Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Springfield, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I have received an email from a recruiter for a phone interview. The phone interview took place that week it was very brief maybe a 10 minute call and then she got back with someone to schedule my second interview for a virtual interview later in the next week. My second interview is tomorrow.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you went above and beyond?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: not too bad. Standard behavioral questions about what would you do in this situation, how would you react, if someone does this how would you handle it etc, etc. A few tough ones about how to handle difficult coworkers.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your background?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had pretty quick responses and follow up until my final (3rd) interview. I was told I would hear back early next week and a couple days went by so I decided to follow up. The recruiter responded pretty quickly and said they went another direction. Okay well how long ago was that decision made?! Recruiters can really make or break a company’s reputation, especially if they are the only contact. After 3 rounds of interviews you owe an interviewee the courtesy to let them know if they didn’t get the job after all the time and energy going into the interviews!
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about handling conflict between yourself and  a coworker?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience, a very nice recruiter. She explained the position in great detail and answered all questions I had. Mercy Health has a great reputation which is what caught my eye to apply there.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in this position.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions:
Great interview experience. Met with them twice and seemed like a great organization to to work for. 

They were very organized and had great communication on days/times. I only met with HR on the first interview over the phone but in person with who would have been my manager.
Interview Questions: Lots of questions on my current role, so make sure you bring a copy of your resume.

title: Senior Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, MO) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very poorly organized and lack of communication in regards to the position. I got the impression they really didn't know what they were looking for and fishing for an applicant.
Interview Questions: What did you do to prepare for the interview?

title: Senior Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: 4 zoom interviews over the course of 4 weeks. Very typical behavioral questions. Not a lot of questions about technical ability, mostly just "rate yourself 1-5 on xyz". Interviewed with direct Manager, 2 colleagues of manager, and Manager's manager.
Interview Questions: Rate your ability with SQL 1-5. Same with Python and Tableau

title: Talent Acquisition Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: HR screening, talking with intern university specialist, call with manager. After third phone call was called by the university specialist with an offer. The offer was sent to me by email that day.
Interview Questions: What makes you interested in the company?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Started with applying online. I was quickly approached by a recruiter. The recruiter was very knowledgeable, asked basic qualifying questions and was asked if I'd like to set up an interview on any of the units available. I received a link for references to send an email and had an interview within a week.
Interview Questions: How would others describe yo

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: First you must get pass phone interview before you get one with any manager. I was not aware on their page that I must enter the 1 year residency program where i must stay there for 3 more years after that or else I will have to pay them back ten grand. I find it kind of foolish that I have a bachelors already and still need to go into the program to train for something I was already taught.
Interview Questions: She read me the mission on their website and asked me why do i fit in their mission.

title: Social Worker/Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Springfield, OH) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was virtual. I spoke with a recruiter and answered basic questions and then spoke with the unit manager of unit I would work on. Primarily discussed experience level and anything I might be unfamiliar with.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with  navigating electronic medical records?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with recruiter prior to interview. Zoom interview with nurse manager and a couple other nurses on the floor. Interview was short and sweet. Typical tell me about yourself and behavioral questions. Offered the job shortly after.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you received criticism and how you handled it.

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by in person interview. Hiring manager was very informative. Basic interview questions at first followed by more detailed based on resume/CV given. Informative process throughout. Helpful explaining roles and duties of job as well as average patient load.
Interview Questions: Case based questions

title: Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen with hr and then in person interview with supervisor of revenue cycle department. Offer extended after first in person interview. Very informal due to job being entry level. Basically would hire anyone that walked through the door.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit to the organization?

title: Patient Care Associate (PCA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Boardman, OH) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was great! Very friendly and made sure to express my concerns during interview. Hired instantly. No problems during the process. Treated me very nicely. Did not take the job offer however.
Interview Questions: What’s your strength and weaknesses?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Incredibly long online application (experience, personality surveys). Submitted to dark hole of the internet with a generic auto received email. No follow up or ability to communicate on process/status. Able to go back to a portal, but no help.
Interview Questions: Standard, experience, strengths and opportunities, motive.

title: Bloodbank Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview for their bloodbank.  The woman in charge of the interview was pleasant enough and knew that I would be graduating from the MLT program the next month and that my bloodbank rotation was the last one that I would be completing.  She basically told me before I left that day that she really would like to hire me and then asked me to come in and shadow for a couple hours to make sure that I really liked it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your last job, why did you leave your last job, why did you apply for this job, are there any other jobs that you applied for

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
Had one on site interview. The person interviewing me was not prepared for the interview. Never read my resume, didn't even have a copy my resume. I definitely was qualified for the position, but what can you do if it seems like a 1way street?
Of course I followed up as a proper etiquette but not a single reply from anyone in 2 months.
Recently an internal recruiter reached out to me about the same position.
Interview Questions:
General questions regarding what to expect.
Had no issues with any questions. Straight forward and none of them "Tell me why do you want to work here" insanity questions.

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. Interviewed with 4 different people. Asked about experience and scenario based questions. Very nice people who interviewed me. Took about an hour and half for the whole interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to deal with a difficult patient and how you handled it

title: Human Resources Knowledge and Content Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I first had a screening call with the recruiter and then another call with the hiring manager. The hiring manager seemed to like me and even told me to keep my calendar open for the following week for a face-to-face. I have not heard anything since.
Interview Questions: The questions were the typical stuff about my background, however there was one question about whether I would have a problem working in a religious based organization.

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a technical position. I felt that the interviewer was rude throughout the process despite offering me the job afterwards. I have heard others with somewhat similar stories
Interview Questions: How would you rate your technical expertise in each catagory

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Paducah, KY)
Interview Descriptions:
Had 3 interviews
1 phone interview 
1 interview with operations level management
1 interview with all the doctors and coo
Interviews took place over a 6 weeks period. It was a long vetting process.
Interview Questions:
Type of previous Experience in the field
Asked about management style and how to solve complex issues

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: very relaxed environment, easy going interviewer that was super friendly and inviting. I highly suggest this employer to anyone.  The process was very straight forward, your typical questions were asked as well as what you driving force is healthcare is.
Interview Questions: the most difficult question was what my faults are, it difficult to come up with an answer on the spot that's not self incriminating

title: Enviromental Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: straight to the point just seems like they jus t want bodies no real skill needed i currently work for them in gr planning to switch the management is unprofessional and will lie asap to stay out of trouble
Interview Questions: i dont remember them asking a lot of questions

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Process: Phone Screen, Phone interview with director, in person interview, offer 

Timeline was very quick. Two weeks for the three interviews and then a week waiting for a decision.

From application to hire about 3.5 weeks.
Interview Questions:
Basic qualification questions over the phone calls.

The in person interview was a bit different

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a little lengthy, but not stressful. I did a phone interview, then had an interview with a couple of employees. It was no more than a week later that I was notified of a decision.
Interview Questions: Typical personality question.

title: Corporate Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (New York, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process took about 4 weeks. Initial phone screen with questions about why I wanted to work for Mercy Health and what my salary expectations were. Followed by an invitation for an in person peer interview. Two rounds of interviews, very friendly and easygoing atmosphere. Also had to invite former colleagues to answer questions about my personality and work style. Two weeks later I got invited for another peer interview.  Received offer the same day.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Business Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, In-person interview -- very laid back and conversational. Mostly behavioral "tell me about a time..." Had a few questions in regards to my passions/interests. I think this is the most important part of the interview for them.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict between 2 team members?

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applied for jewish hospital through glass-door, was emailed a couple days later to pick a day for a phone interview. Was asked a few questions on the phone interview then she said I was moved on to the next step which was a in person interview a couple days later. I did my in person interview and was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for mercy ?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Online assessments, hr interview  manager  interview  peer interview and job shadow .got a feedback  after  three  days. Was moderate  just a long process.
Interview Questions: Conflict resolution

title: Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied and a week later received an email for interview with HR. After initial interview, another interview with the hiring manager. I felt really good about everything and two days later, I received the offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Preregistration Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Mason, OH) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was an open interview so there were several people interviewing at the same time. The interviewers first asked questions about my background/work history and a few job specific questions like had I ever answered the phone regularly at work. Then they asked four situation specific questions about prior jobs, like what did u do when the issue came up, what action did u take and what the result was. Lastly they asked a few questions about work preferences like do u like to work in a group or alone.
Interview Questions: If you were working with someone on a team and they were always late for work, what would u do?

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: After sending in my application, I then received an email asking for a phone screening. After the phone screening I went in for an in person interview.  The interview process went well. I suggest wearing business casual.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Mercy?  What  made you Interested in this position? Name a time you went above and beyond the normal requirements of your current position. Name a time you helped a co-worker.

title: Cst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Elyria, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Make sure your ready with a resume and be friendly they will ask questions about your skills what you can and cannot do why u r considering the position any lincense or certifications
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with mercy

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Warren, OH) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview went smooth, staff was very knowledgeable and answered all my questions. Very friendly atmosphere and things went great.  I did not receive an offer however, but have been given other opportunities.
Interview Questions: Are you flexible?

title: Scribe Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions about my motivations for applying, plans for the future, and how both of those parallel each other/ influence my want to become a scribe! This was followed up by questions on my availability and how many shifts I was planning on working!
Interview Questions: What do you expect to get out of working as a scribe at our company?

title: Chaplain Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Toledo, OH) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Intensive and very personal with a lot of documentation per ACPE standards. In addition to all the ACPE paperwork, there is also a phone or Skype interview with Chaplains currently on staff. There is also a drug and criminal background test, in addition to immunization requirements. It's a hospital. CPE residencies in general are extremely competitive and not for everyone. The interviewers are looking for more than educational sufficiency and people skills, they are particularly looking for how you take criticism and practice self care.
Interview Questions: Areas for growth and development will come up.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: HR called me to do a phone screening and ask basic questions of why I wanted to work there. After that she scheduled an interview with the floor manager. After the interview with the floor manager, you get an occupational health appt for work clearance (drug test, physical, etc)
Interview Questions: How do you fit in with our mission?

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Fair and easy going , Very nice and friendly  and they made eye contact focused on you to figure if you would be a great fix infirmed you of what the next steps would be
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Remote Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Absolutely, the most unprofessional HR staff. I applied online holding 3 relevant certs. Over 6 weeks later, I received an email asking 3 dates/times I am available for a phone interview, for that week, what is the best phone number, and oh what are your salary requirements. Further states once responses are recieved they will notify me of date and time of phone interview. I respond immediately and then I receive absolutely nothing in return... not a thank you, not a date/time for a chance to even speak to someone about the position and my qualifications...nothing. Meanwhile, they continue to post and repost the coding jobs. So on the off chance that they didnt receive my email, I reach out again. I immediately am told my salary is "close" but a bit higher, would I still be interested. I respond stating that I look at a total package... pay, all benefits, etc so YES I was still interested in learning more about the position, hospital, benefits.... I then again hear nothing yet they keep posting coding jobs.  After reading the reviews, I am thankful.... sounds like they are understaffed, underpaid, and HR is clearly not interested in trying to recruit qualified, certified candidates or engaging in a more personal form of communication beyond email.... My advice, try calling and talking to potential candidates, as not everything can or should be discussed on email. Human communication/interaction can be beneficial.
Interview Questions: What are your salary requirements

title: Safety Companion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Time consuming. It took almost 2 months to start training. I went through 3 interviews two in the phone and one in person. Once I was hired it took about a month to start orientation. A month to finish. Then I could start actually working.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the Mercy Ministry

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: In order to move forward with phone or in person interviews you have to pass a comprehensive test that gages if you would be able to handle the amount of information you will need to learn to become epic certified. If you pass this test then the interviews start happening. The overall process from application to hire was about 4 months for me.
Interview Questions: What would you say are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: First did a phone interview, then was scheduled for a 1:1. All done within about one week. Showed up, went to conference room, and had the interview. Behavioral based interview questions.
Interview Questions: How do I manage stress since nursing has a high burnout rate

title: Physician Billing Specialist/Professional Billing Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had 1 interview with 2 interviewers,  than I was invited to a career fair, than invited for another interview with 5 interviewers and 2 hours after that second interview they give me an offer. I declined it. I would happily enjoy the team and accept their offer but I was absolutely surprised by the low pay they have offered. $15/hour just didn’t work for me. And I am still impressed by that number...
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Describe a stressful situation at your current/past job and how you’ve handle it? Describe a problem at your previous job and how you resolve it? What is npi number or what place of service I would use in some specific situation (and a few other very specific questions related to medical billing). Both interviews was completely different. At the first one they was asking me more general question, like my previous experience, why I choose mercy, why do I left my previous job etc. At my second interview they asked me questions related specific for the position I applied.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, department interview, hired and I shadowed for half a shift before accepting position and I am looking forward to the opportunity so far everyone I have came in contact with have been vey pleasant
Interview Questions: why i became a nurse

title: Risk Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email a few minutes later to take two online test; one was a personality test and the other was a basic academic skills test. The next day, I received an email from a recruiter to set up a phone interview. A couple weeks later, I went to Cincinnati to interview with four corporate managers. The following week, I interviewed with six local managers. Shortly after that, The original recruiter called me with an offer.
Interview Questions: The recruiter asked my salary requirements, why I felt I would fit in with the mission, and other very general questions.  In the phone interview, I was asked more specific questions about how I would handle different situations relevant to the position. During the corporate interviews, we mainly discussed specifics of the position and our expectations, and the local interviews were very much the same. At every level, the interviewers emphasized the mission.

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: You will get an email first to set a phone interview, After the phone interview is the face to face with a manager then a face to face for a peer interview
Interview Questions: How do you define professionalism?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Ll Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Interview went really well . I interviewed with a pharmacy manager and an intern and then interviewed with a Technician and a staff pharmacist ..... I had a lot of pharmacy experience going in so the questions asked were just about my past pharmacy experience. Then they asked normal interview questions :) .... I received a job offer the next day and everyone is so sweet . 😍❤️
Interview Questions: How do you handle workplace conflicts ?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions:
I had an initial phone interview with the recruiter. First, should could not recall how she met me. I had to refresh her memory that she reached out to me directly as she got my name through networking.  

It was obvious she was going off a script vs knowing her audience and having a conversation accordingly. 

She couldn't explain the "new role" they were recruiting for. 

She's recruiting for a management role, yet conducting the call as if talking to a campus recruit.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Mercy?

title: Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter emailed me to set up a time for a phone interview. I emailed back with my days and times for availability. No response to my email, so I emailed again the next day. Again no response to my email. That following Monday I called the recruiter who reached out to me. He sounded very unorganized, didn't apologize for what had happened, and had to check to see about that current job status which he first emailed me about doing a phone interview for. He set up a phone interview for the next morning at nine o'clock. Best part after all this he never called and I never heard from him ever again. What a joke!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: They do a panel type interview. They ask you general questions about team work and conflict resolution. They want you to explain why you want to be in healthcare.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you went above the call of service for your patient.

title: Student Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Lima, OH) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two people sat across from me and essentially asked me questions pertaining to my schooling and what I’ve learned that I would be putting into use in my role at this hospital
Interview Questions: Do you feel you would be able to perform required job tasks without a lot of direction from other staffing, once comfortable in this setting.

title: Diector of Digital Marketing Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Taylor Mill, KY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Took two online questionnaires, one was timed and asked a variety of mathematical questions, the other was more of a personality assessment. Took about 30 minutes total. They followed up very promptly indicating they wanted someone with a better fit.
Interview Questions: Didn't actually get to speak to a person, but the assessment questions were along the lines of 'I always look for opportunities for advancement' and things like that with the option choose to agree/disagree/neutral as it pertains to you.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Springfield, OH) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and had six different interviews (at separate times) with different people. I used a lot of my vacation time to take time off work to schedule these interviews since they were always in the middle of the day.  After four months of interviewing, I never heard another thing from anyone. I never got a call or an email telling me that I wasn't chosen.  Very disappointing to have so much time wasted and have no idea what went wrong.  Please keep your candidates informed as it's frustrating for people to spend so much time and energy only to never hear anything again, especially after having six interviews and four months of time in. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict in the work place?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: First they have a phone interview with you. If you get through that, they set up a face to face interview with manager and department head. They ask you questions back and forth about clinical experience as well as your role in the department.
Interview Questions: How do you work with someone who doesn't want to work as a team?

title: Reimbursement Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the head of the department.  Then a company paid hotel stay to attend a multi-part on-site interview with supervisory staff followed by a lunch with the rest of the team.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult challenge at work and how I overcame it.

title: Emergency Department RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone interview then asked to come in and meet with the hiring manager. the interview lasted about 45 mins. I also met with a charge nurse during the interview time frame who then asked me additional questions. The interview was somewhat laid back but serious at the same time.
Interview Questions: I was asked why I wanted to work in the ED and what I could bring to the department/company if hired. I was also asked about their core values and mission and how I feel I fit in to those.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Youngstown, OH) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process included several steps.  First is the online application.  If there are any questions the recruited will call.  After that has been accepted, an email with a link to taking two online assessment tests is sent.  Once completed the recruiter contacts you again.  As an external candidate for a job that required relocation, Mercy decided on an internal candidate.
Interview Questions: Would you take two online assessments?

title: Telemetry Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Springfield, OH) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple. Want a lot of experience answers. Help if you have health expericence or customer service experience. Interview may be with multiple nurse managers or just one. I don’t remember.
Interview Questions: Describe a a time where you had to deal with a difficult patient/customer

title: Applications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: You have to pass the Epic certification exam before you get an interview. If you pass, then you meet with a recruiter. After that, you meet with team lead managers. Then they will bring you back in with the team lead managers again and the director. You'll have a peer interview afterwards.
Interview Questions: What motivates you?

title: HR Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Bizarre.  Interviewed.  Hiring manager said she wanted someone with Hospital experience, although she had no hospital experience herself.  Then after being rejected for the job, I was contacted again to see if I was still interested, was given names of people who would call me back.  They never called, so I called the hiring manager after a few weeks and was told I must have been confused.
Interview Questions: Called to ask if I was still interested in position after 3-6 months after interview, but then after another several weeks, they totally dropped the ball and acted like I was the one confused about their interest in me.  If this is how they treat HR applicants, I don't want to work in HR for them.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy to navigate through the recruiting process and contact the recruiter. A lot of detailed information about the position with the organization. Meeting with the hiring manager was great and they followed up right away.
Interview Questions: What was my previous training experience?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and easy. They called me in right away and asked a few questions related to the position. The people I met were nice and friendly. They also called me back within a reasonable amount of time to let me know their thoughts about me being in that position.
Interview Questions: Why should we pick you?

title: URO Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Kentwood, MI) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: My first interview was a phone interview.The second was a panel interview with 3 people asking a variety of questions. I thought that it was rather difficult. However, I do not like behavioral interview questions.
Interview Questions: How do you motive others?

title: Customer Service Agent I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Mason, OH)
Interview Descriptions: You apply online, have a phone interview then a face to face interview. During the interview they ask about your skills on computers and speaking with customers. They ask you to describe how you deal with people with difficult personalities and how you deal with people when there is a misunderstanding. My interview was at 5pm I was 10 minutes early and they took me in early we were done at 537.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you.

title: Surery Schduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position and received a call from the practice manager about 1 month later, which is pretty good for such a large healthcare institution, in my experience. I scheduled my interview within the next week, and was called with an offer about 4 days later.
Interview Questions: How well do you adapt to a rapidly changing environment?

title: Telesitter Observer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied online called for an interview two weeks later hired on spot. I interviewed with the manager. Once hired she had to submit through HR. Had to wait for Hr to call you to confirm you accept job. Hr call and tell you salary and start date.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with an employee that you disagree with

title: Customer Service Agent I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: in person interview, met with manager, asked about background, education, previous experience.  manger was friendly and explained position and responsibilities to me . went over scheduling and hours, answered all my questions. interview lasted approximately 50 minutes. received call back 4 days later and was offered job
Interview Questions: what is your weakness

title: Supply Chain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Youngstown, OH) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I met with supply management and had a short interview. Management was very friendly. The conversation flowed easily. I did not feel stressed. Questions were straight forward. They each asked a handful of general questions. Interview was shorter than 30 minutes but informative. 
Recruitment offered a position the next day.
Interview Questions:
What was your previous job enviornment?
Have you worked in health care previously?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Perrysburg, OH) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: you apply at their website, they review your resume and will call you if they like what they see, also if you get a choice/opportunity to do a school externship they 9/10 times will hire you with well above payscale. the interview will be with the office you applied for, then if it goes well you will do a peer interview (usually means you got it) then hr will call you and go over your experience and offer your pay and you either can negotiate accept or decline. after that ( if you accepted) you will be emailed all your paperwork for payroll, w4 ect, you'll have to go to a website link they send you to do your back ground check, they require 5 professional references 2 that have to be direct supervisors and you need all their emails because you'll be sending them a survey from mercy about you, you'll then need all your credentials certifications and will be scheduled to just turn that in and do a pe with drug screen, then be given an orientation date. the orientation date will be changed if you didn't get all your paperwork in and your orientation date is your first day you get paid. employment is contingent on you completing the pre-employment screens.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Human Resource Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: The process is too automated with redundant questionnaires; thus, eliminating opportunity to actually speak face-to-face with someone. Unfortunately, their process is used more for screening then trying to find talented workers. First steps should be phone interview and review of cross-functional skills but after reading reviews it appears that may only happen if you know someone.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Applications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
there was a onsite job interview and then 2 more phone interviews depending on your location.
i attended the job fair where i met managers from different departments.
i was then contacted to take an Epic assessment test which i took.
after that i did not hear for a month from them.
then i had a onsite interview with other managers on the conference line.
Interview Questions: do you know HL7?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Filled out an application for the New grad nurse residency program. Completed a short phone screening with a recruiter. Went in a few weeks later for an interview. Interview was fluid and professional. Toured the unit. Waited to hear back from the nurse manager or the recruiter with a job offer.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you?

title: Speech Language Pathologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone interview with HR department and then had a webcam interview with 3 workers from the specific location. Everyone was very nice and made the interview atmosphere comfortable!
Interview Questions: Give me three things you would expect from us as a company.

title: Vice President Healthcare Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
very quick and easy. had fired previous leader so quick to fill
had phone interview with 2 people then in person with two senior executives. Covered organization goals and mission and needs for the position
Interview Questions: what was my related experience and how could I add new ideas to help solve the specific organizational problems

title: Learning & Development Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Great process. Very thorough and professional.  I had the chance to meet with all the stakeholders and get a sense for the role and organization.   The organization is mission-centered and cares about its patients as well as the health professionals that serve them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Simple and painless. Was offered job within the first 10 minutes of the interview. Management seemed like they knew what they were doing, until it was obvious they were (literally) reading from a script.
Interview Questions: How would you solve an ethical dilemma with a patient?

title: Special Financial Clearance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Youngstown, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews which were preliminary. Small conference room, two interviewers doing the process. The job itself wasn't described to me in great detail but the pay and the hours were. Nice and personable. A hair drug test and a physical were set up and I couldn't officially start working until those results came back all clear.
Interview Questions: "Would you feel comfortable asking patients for copays occasionally?"

title: STNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Toledo, OH)
Interview Descriptions: I applied and didn't hear from them for almost a month. The interview was with three nurse manager and an RN. Each would go around and ask one question, I would reply then move on to the next question. Although it was intimidating have a panel interview they all made me feel comfortable.
Interview Questions: Why you want to work for them? What makes a good leader? Past clinical experience.

title: Financial Clearance Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Mason, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone interview, then i was called for a 1:1 with a couple of leads then about 3 weeks later I accepted an offer letter. I will say the process was smooth and sort of quick
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: HR person did a phone screen interview and literally just red the questions robotically while she typed my answers.  Very impersonal.  Didn't know my background.  Didn't have much information about the role.  Very much a waste of my time.  Even asked me about my proficiency at MS Office.  Honestly, I was very insulted.
Interview Questions: How proficient are you at MS Office?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Lorain, OH) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: first they will call you in to complete a typing test, then a group interview with all of the area practice managers followed by shadowing at one of the doctors office to see if the lead ma likes you
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to think fast to solve a problem

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cleveland, OH) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, interview was set up for 2 days later. Before interview they require a typing test then you do a panel interview. Following that you shadow for your selected place and then the office manager makes the decision to bring you on or not. Whole process took about a week
Interview Questions: Name a time where you had to think fast in a difficult decision

title: Applications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with company representative at a job fair.  Then I was contacted by an HR representative for a phone interview.  That led to taking an assessment test.
Interview Questions: What type of software applications have you worked with?

title: Applications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Even though I was told many times I'm still being considered, haven't been contacted in over a month after several back to back interviews. I took several tests, had several interviews, then heard nothing. Reached out on my own many times and was reassured that I was still being considered, just seems like they forgot about me.
Interview Questions: are you ok with traveling 30-60%?

title: RN Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: First, I applied online and was prompted to take an assessment test, to evaluate whether I was seen as a good fit for the culture of the company. I then completed a quick 10 min. screen on the phone, conducted by a recruiter. Next, I was brought in for a series of 3 more interviews that included a combination of staff (peers, supervisors and CNO's).  Overall, I felt that they really took the time to get to know me, and establish my ability to be a member of their team which I find to be helpful not only to the candidate but to their peers as well.
Interview Questions: Why did I chose to go into recruitment

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health
Interview Descriptions: Paper resume and certification documentation must be provided. Interview includes at least one physician, management, and three current working MA's within practice. Research the practice and procedures as well as what you are seeking from the practice and reasons why you are there. They were slightly unorganized which made the interview less stressful for me and also did not inform me of very important factors about the practice I would of preferred to of known in advance.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation involving a disagreement between yourself and a co-worker?

title: Patient Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Anderson, OH) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had two phone interviews with two separate recruiters, followed by a face to face interview with department manager as well as a peer interview with two PCA's on the unit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Mercy?

title: Human Resources Business Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a brief phone screen with a recruiter.  The next step was an hour long phone interview with the director of HR.  Unfortunately, the recruiter handling the process did not confirm the interview, so I was completely caught off guard when they called.  I went with it, and did the interview.  Questions were standard, talking through each position held and discussing the opportunity at hand.  The next step was an in person interview with both the director and the incumbent of the position.  Once again, the recruiter did not confirm anything or provide me details, so they were surprised and unorganized upon my arrival.  Questions here were a little more probing, and a lot of hypothetical situational questions.  After the interview finished, things went well enough they called me in the evening (around 8 p.m. on a Friday) to ask me to prepare a portfolio and informed I may have one more telephone interview to complete.  After sending my portfolio on Monday, the recruiter asked me to confirm an entire day 5 person interview schedule on short notice.  This was unexpected, and impractical while working full time.  I asked if we could schedule this step at another time, maybe taking a half day instead of a whole day, and the recruiter said she'd get back to me.  Weeks later, she never got back to me as promised, to give me any update at all.  The process appears to have no organization, it was a terrible representation to the  company and the HR department.
Interview Questions: how do you quickly gain credibility with business leaders?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Youngstown, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied for one job and offered another and interviewed with director . One on one and discussed my resume and willingness to work in a management position rather than staff position
Interview Questions: 5 yr plan

title: Surgical Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Toledo, OH) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview Process was very well checked with many of questions with detail of my job duty , I feel that the peer interview are the best way to get to know a person ,with many different views and out looks of a person and their skills, it is very important to know that a person  is there for the well being of the patients and to be part of a winning team ready to give a 100% daily
Interview Questions: what can I bring to the hospital

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Average interview like any other company. Nothing really serious. it might also depend on your hiring manager. Mine was a peach. I got the job  not too long after. Had to consider between two other offers. But i chose this place
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, called by HR person, who conducted an on interview with no warning.  Interviewed in person a week later.  Team oriented, lovely people, and I thought it went well.  No offer, in spite of over 15 years experience.  I think it was my age.
Interview Questions: None. Typical interview questions.

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Table interview with 3 members of management , interview was about 30 minutes long. Be prepared. Lots of difficult questions and examples of patient care. Management was very friendly but asked many difficult questions.
Interview Questions: where do I see myself in 5 years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Springfield, OH)
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted an application for the emergency room, and was called shortly afterwards asking if I'd be willing to work on a renal floor instead. I had to call the hiring manager repeatedly (4 times) in order to actually set up the interview. I had one 1-on-1 interview, in which I was told there was 3 positions available: a full time, a part time, and a PRN position. I told her I would be happy with any position. I was called the next day by HR to be informed I was given the part time position. 

I had to present my graduation diploma (a first for me) to prove I graduated from nursing school (although my licensure as an RN should prove that....).
Interview Questions: "If a call light were going off, a ventilator alarm beeping, and you had a lot of charting to do, how would you prioritize your work?"

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Oberlin, OH) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by a colleague, so the process of quick and required topics to fill the time. Now there is a different supervisor who is still relaxed, but ultimately inefficient.
The only issue was that the company itself only does orientation once or twice a month, so the hiring process gets held back easily.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Toledo, OH) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Low pressure and really easy to talk to everyone even though i was very nervous. I had two interviews. 1 with management and a peer interview with other technicians
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Mercy?

title: Social Worker II, Behaviora Health Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Paducah, KY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of meeting multiple staff, doctors and people in administration.  My interview was quite informal even though I met all these other employees.  They didn't ask me many questions.  They had actually asked me to come work there so by the time the interview happened they seemed to already have their mind made up.  Most questions that I recall were in regards to my ability to work with those with mental illness and substance abuse.  The interview was mostly a meet-and-greet.
Interview Questions: "How do you feel about working with people with substance abuse"   It wasn't a hard question but its the only one I recall.

title: PCA Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Paducah, KY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: unorganized training , asked questions about patient care I answered correctly people were friendly .only on interview
Interview Questions: about entering patients homes , asking if I judge the way they live my response was "I'm not there for that I am there for patient care" .

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Contacted through campus recruiting. First a phone interview with the firing manager, followed by a web ex session with the team leads. Third was the on-site interview. Pretty basic questions. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Healthcare Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 9 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The whole process from start to finish took 9 months.  I applied for the position and was contacted a month later.  My first phone interview was 2 months after I applied.  I went on face to face interviews - three months after I applied - and ended up speaking to 14 people, some of the higher-ups were one-on-one but there were some peer interviews.  The peer interviews had no structure.  They would go around the table debating who would ask what questions.  I got the impression they had done this before... but it was not well structured. From interview to interview the questions were pretty much the same.  I would have thought I would be asked different questions to get a better understanding of who I am and what my background is.  After my last interview, the recruiter said that a decision would be made quickly - by that Friday or no later than the following Monday.  A week later, I called to check in and was told a decision hadn't been made.  A few days later, they called me still saying a decision hadn't been made.  That was their last contact.  Five months later I received an email stating that the position had been filled.  They do not do a good job with follow-thru and the interview process is too long and too involved.
Interview Questions: There were no odd questions, just the same type of question over and over.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The entire process took quite a bit of time, but that was because there was some reorganization occurring at the time. Once the interviews took place, it did not take long to get a decent offer.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple priorities?

title: RN Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I first had a phone interview with a recruiter then was forwarded to interview/set up interview with Manager of Department & Manager associate and another Nurse Care Coordinator who described job responsibilities in detail to have a better idea of job duties.  Overall, it was a very comfortable interview I felt like I was part of a team already.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years from now?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy Health (New York, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was ver lengthy with the HR. A lot of psycho-analytical questions. Following was the interview with the PT department which was more informal and casual.
Interview Questions: How will you treat a difficult client? It seemed like a vague question, there is so much to talk about depending on the client's illness.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Warren, OH) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I first went directly to the unit manager and informed her of my application and desire to work in the labor and delivery area. Next, I had Two peer interviews followed by an interview with the unit manager. Before long I was hired and began working the floo
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work labor and delivery?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Answer questions thur and email testing site then Peer to Peer interview with 3 employees, MD and manager. Job shadow for 4 hours.  Phone interview then offer over the phone
Interview Questions: How many times were you late for work in the past year

title: X-ray Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Went well.  The manager was nice and easy to talk to.  They did not make me feel intimidated.  They took the time to answer any questions I had.  We walked around the department.
Interview Questions: If I had my xray license, or still needed to take my registry.

title: Applications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an application for the position I was initially contacted by a recruiting company that works directly with CHP.  This took about three months from when I first submitted my application.  My first interview was over the phone with the recruiter.  The recruiter does the pre-screening for the company.  The recruiter asked me about my background, specific questions about my resume, and then told me a little bit about what the position entails, what the company was looking for, and the demands of the job.  At the end of the interview she said she would forward my resume on to the hiring manager at CHP for review and if they decided to move forward with the next steps she would contact me further.  Two weeks later the recruiter contacted me to set up a phone interview with the hiring manager.  She gave me a little bit of insight regarding what they would ask and how the interview would go.  Her advice was spot on.  My initial phone interview was then rescheduled the night of due to a conflict in schedule with the hiring manager.  The phone interview was rescheduled for the following day.  The phone interview with the hiring manager consisted of mostly talking about my background, and why I was leaving my current employer.  At the end of the interview he said he needed to follow up with the rest of his team and that he had a few more phone interviews to conduct before he could make a decision.  It took two weeks to hear back from the recruiter.  Once contacted an onsite interview was scheduled.  I met with three people.  The Hiring manager, the team lead, and a peer on the team.  The interview consisted of more questions about my background and a lot of questions regarding what my process is to solve problems.  The question came up at least 4 times.  I wasn't sure if maybe he was looking for a different answer than what I originally gave but I I stuck with my answer each time the question came up.  We went through a few scenarios about if this happens what do you do, etc.  They discussed the demands of the job and asked if I could handle them.  The interview ended abruptly and I was told I would be contacted by the recruiter if they decided to move forward.
Interview Questions: The questions were not difficult, but the interviewers had a tenancy to ask the same few questions over and over.  Sometimes the wording was a bit different, other times it was the exact same.  I am not sure exactly why they did this other than to see how confident you were in your original answer.

title: Lab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy Health in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: start with interview with hiring manager, then they refer to a peer group interview team, who get the final say. It is great to talk with the employees you will actually be working with.
Interview Questions: do you smoke?  They do not hire smokers

title: Insurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Springfield, OH) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very super quick and easy. I felt very comfortable meeting with the department manager and department director for the interview. Unfortunately all of the good leadership team is no longer working there due to incompetent leadership and overtaking of headquarters in Cincinnati, OH.
Interview Questions: Standard questions. Focused on skills, knowledge, strengths and weaknesses.

title: Certified Surgical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Oregon, OH) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interview with clinical manager, interview with peers, called offered the job. I accepted and was scheduled for the next orientation that was 3 weeks away, one through the 3 month orientation and training period I was on my own and well trained.
Interview Questions: Where would you like to be in 5 years

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy Health (Cincinnati, OH) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Beginning of the process was great.  Communication was very good.  I had applied for 2 different positions and was an employee referral.  One-on-one interview was good - office is very nice and culture seemed very team-oriented.  Next was phone interview with remote person.  I felt that that person's mind was already made up.  I think they weigh healthcare experience extremely highly, and I did not have much.
Interview Questions: What methods of business analysis have you used, and compare them.
